column1: One after the other the boys entered the opening beyond. At first they could see but little
column2: but gradually their eyes became accustomed to the gloom and they made out a rocky chamber about twelve feet wide and running back in irregular shape for a hundred feet or more. At some points the ceiling was so low they had to stoop
column3: while elsewhere it was far above their reach. The flooring was fairly level
column4: with rock in some places and hard dirt in others.The opening was rudely furnished with a heavy table and a bench
column5: and close to one wall was a box bed
column6: still filled with pine boughs. On a big wooden hook hung a man's coat
column7: so decayed that it began to fall apart when they touched it. The table contained several tin cups and plates
